snippet: The largest household products maker, cut its sales and earnings outlook to reflect the devaluation of currencies in various developing markets.
abstract: Procter & Gamble, large household products maker, cut its sales and earnings outlook for the year to reflect unfavorable foreign exchange rates in Venezuela and the devaluation of currencies in various developing markets; says it now expects growth in core earnings per share of 3 to 5 percent, down from previous estimate of 5 to 7 percent.
lead_paragraph: The largest household products maker, cut its sales and earnings outlook to reflect the devaluation of currencies in various developing markets.

headline.main: Procter & Gamble Cuts Earnings Forecast for Year
headline.print_headline: Procter & Gamble Cuts Earnings Forecast for Year
